snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron rejected suggestions that he traded policies favorable to Rupert Murdoch for electoral support from Mr. Murdoch’s newspapers.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron, testifying at Britain's long-running inquiry into media standards, rejects suggestions that he traded favored treatment for electoral support by Rupert Murdoch’s newspapers; despite denial, British commentators seize upon text message sent by Rebekah Brooks that appeared to hint at a greater intimacy between Cameron and Murdoch's elite.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron rejected suggestions that he traded policies favorable to Rupert Murdoch for electoral support from Mr. Murdoch’s newspapers.

headline.seo: At British Inquiry, David Cameron Denies Deals With Rupert Murdoch
headline.main: At British Inquiry, Cameron Denies ‘Deals’ With Murdoch
headline.print_headline: Cameron Dismisses Accusations of Deal With Murdoch Family

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
